conversations.content: How much did I spend on shopping today?

<function_thought>
The user wants to know how much they spent on shopping today. To determine this, I need to:
1. Find out what today's date is.
2. Retrieve the order history to identify any purchases made today.
3. Get the invoices for those orders to find the payment amounts.
4. Calculate the total amount spent on today's purchases.

First, I will get the current day.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_current_day()]</function_call>

<final_answer>
</final_answer>

<function_thought>
Today is 2024-05-19. Now I will retrieve the order history to identify any purchases made today.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[view_order_history()]</function_call>

<final_answer>
</final_answer>

{'Order 1': {'order_id': 'ORDER-104674', 'product_name': 'Adidas Mens Z.n.e. T-Shirt', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-04-18', 'delivery_date': '2024-04-20', 'product_id': 'P030'}, 'Order 2': {'order_id': 'ORDER-107495', 'product_name': 'TechBrand Precision Wireless Mouse', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-05-06', 'delivery_date': '2024-05-10', 'product_id': 'P045'}, 'Order 3': {'order_id': 'ORDER-112543', 'product_name': 'Portable SSD 1TB', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-05-19', 'delivery_date': '2024-05-19', 'product_id': 'P009'}, 'Order 4': {'order_id': 'ORDER-113219', 'product_name': 'SpeedStep Running Shoes', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-05-19', 'delivery_date': None, 'product_id': 'P023'}}

<function_thought>
There are two orders placed today (2024-05-19):
- ORDER-112543 for a Portable SSD 1TB
- ORDER-113219 for SpeedStep Running Shoes

I need to get the invoices for these orders to find the payment amounts.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_invoice(order_id="ORDER-112543"), get_invoice(order_id="ORDER-113219")]</function_call>

<final_answer>
</final_answer>
The invoice has been sent to your email inbox.
The invoice has been sent to your email inbox.

The invoices for both orders have been sent to the email inbox. I need to retrieve the unread emails to get the invoice details.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_shopping_linked_unread_emails()]</function_call>

<final_answer>

<function_thought>
I need to download the invoice files attached to the emails to get the payment amounts for the orders. The attachments are identified by their IDs: '12' for ORDER-112543 and '13' for ORDER-113219.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[download_file_through_id(file_id="12", save_dir="/downloads"), download_file_through_id(file_id="13", save_dir="/downloads")]</function_call>

<final_answer>
</final_answer>
Invoice_ORDER-112543.txt has been added to downloads.
Invoice_ORDER-113219.txt has been added to downloads.

<function_thought>
The invoice files have been downloaded. I will now read the contents of these files to extract the payment amounts.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/downloads/Invoice_ORDER-112543.txt"), read_file(path="/downloads/Invoice_ORDER-113219.txt")]</function_call>

<final_answer>
</final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have retrieved the payment amounts for the orders placed today:
- ORDER-112543 (Portable SSD 1TB): $96.00
- ORDER-113219 (SpeedStep Running Shoes): $45.00

I will now calculate the total amount spent on shopping today by summing these amounts.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[cart_total()]</function_call>

<final_answer>
</final_answer>

<function_thought>
The cart_total function returned a value of $175.97, which does not match the sum of the two invoices ($96.00 + $45.00 = $141.00). This discrepancy suggests the cart_total function is not appropriate for calculating the total spent on completed orders. Instead, I will calculate the total manually.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[]</function_call>

<final_answer>
You spent a total of $141.00 on shopping today. This includes:
- $96.00 for the Portable SSD 1TB (ORDER-112543)
- $45.00 for the SpeedStep Running Shoes (ORDER-113219)
</final_answer>
